column5: Hey Guys, my dad just recently got back into the country after a while  and seeing that friday is a holiday id like to take him fishing is there any open water near lake simcoe or cooks bay ? he wants to fish for jumbos or pike when i was a kid we used to fish the bay in Adeline Park  for jumbo perch does anyone know if thats open or still frozen over it would be nice to go there with my dad like the old days any help is appreciated!
zone 20 Pike closes on Friday...maybe consider that?  If so, see you out there
Okay, i didnt know that wouldnt keep em even if they were in season and i guess ill see you out there too
sorry...i meant Saturday what the heck am i saying  anyways...ill be in the skeeter bass boat out around the islands.
LOL! ill be fishing from shore what ever shore spots have open water i guess
Lake simcoe is still covered in 2 ft of ice.

im pretty sure everything is wide open...maybe a little ice in the very back channels but aside from that she looks pretty ice free. I spoke with the harbor master today on the phone to get my harbor license and he seemed to imply that I would be travelling through the back channels and warned me that they are not currrently fully marked because its so early in the season. If you see me out there give me a wave.
Are you talking about Simcoe or Toronto?  	My friend is still ice fishing on Simcoe.  So I wouldn't expect it to be wide open just yet.
Toronto Islands, pike fishing before the season closes.   Come on guys!  lol
If I told you where I was going Friday, Bill would drive over and slap me up side the head.  No matter where you end up, enjoy the day with yer pop DJ.
Sounds good! But I guess I’ll have to change my route based one what these guys are saying Take one for the team misfish Lol but thanks anyways
As long as you're safe, I'm good man, lol!   (Although probably a little jealous!!!)
sounds like someone is either going ice fishing...(you are insane) Or to a honey hole...and if so, send your GPS coordinates thanks.
Watch this .... ice_fishing_at_its_craziest.MP4

Confusing thread. One person plans to have the boat out and the other says sim or has 2 feet of ice.....you guys talking about the same simcoe???  i know In the Kawartha most of the lakes are pretty much open now.
trust me i know lol i should have never made this post guess ill be bottom bouncing roe bags again tmr
Simcoe is frozen over. Zone 20 (lake Ontario) is open water.  S.

The OP asked about whether there was any open water near simcoe for pike...I pointed out that Zone 20 closes Saturday hence, theres a great opportunity to fish for some big pike this weekend. I mentioned to keep an eye out for me and give me a wave. Its always good to meet other OFCers
Sorry Budd i guess i read that wrong, where you launching from ? Ill be heading down to the river mouth at one the eastern tribs i fish
Any one know of any sites for current satellite imagery (like Google Earth, but up to date?

humber bay boat launch...ill probably be off the water late morning though, apparently they are calling for 80kmh winds....efff that...unfortuntaely thats probably when the best fishing of the day will be...but 18 foot boats and 80kmh great lakes winds dont mix.  https://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/modis/region_map.html  click on the lake you wanna see its every day
If there's no cloud cover.
Open water where I,ll be. My ice gear is put away,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,   ALMOST,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yeah the winds do look terrible looks like my niece will be spending her time in the car watching movies You must Be going to Area 51 since it’s so top secret
I think he was asking specifically if Lake Simcoe was frozen or if it was open water. I think he wanted to take his dad ice fishing. Thats how I read it
